extendedIngredients.name: bacon

extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash

extendedIngredients.originalName: butternut squash—quartered, seeded, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: canned Roman beans

extendedIngredients.originalName: pinto or roman beans, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: collards

extendedIngredients.originalName: packed cups coarsely chopped collards or kale

extendedIngredients.name: leeks

title: Butternut Squash Soup
summary: Need a gluten free and dairy free main course? Butternut Squash Soup could be a super recipe to try. This recipe serves 6 and costs $1.71 per serving. One serving contains 273 calories, 13g of protein, and 8g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is perfect for Autumn. It is brought to you by Food and Wine. If you have corn kernels, garlic cloves, salt and pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour and 30 minutes. Overall, this recipe earns a good spoonacular score of 70%. Try Butternut Squash : Butternut Squash, Pear and Yogurt Soup, Butternut Squash Soup with Curried Squash Seeds, and 2ways2percent: Butternut Squash Pizzan and Creamy Butternut Squash Puree with Scallops and Bacon for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large, heavy pot, combine the broth, squash, thyme, garlic, leeks and celery and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 45 minutes.                                              In a medium skillet, heat the vegetable oil. Add the bacon strips and cook over moderately high heat, turning once, until crisp, about 7 minutes.                                              Discard the thyme sprigs from the soup. Working in batches, puree the soup in a blender. Return the soup to the pot. Add the bacon, collards, pinto beans, carrot, bell pepper and corn and bring to a boil. Simmer over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 7 minutes. Season the soup with salt and pepper and serve.

steps.step: In a large, heavy pot, combine the broth, squash, thyme, garlic, leeks and celery and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 45 minutes.
In a medium skillet, heat the vegetable oil.
Add the bacon strips and cook over moderately high heat, turning once, until crisp, about 7 minutes.
Discard the thyme sprigs from the soup. Working in batches, puree the soup in a blender. Return the soup to the pot.

Add the bacon, collards, pinto beans, carrot, bell pepper and corn and bring to a boil. Simmer over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 7 minutes. Season the soup with salt and pepper and serve.
